Sentencas: A two-dimensional model is developed to simulate the performance of methane fueled solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), focusing on the effect of electrolyte type on SOFC performance.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The model considers the heat and mass transfer, direct internal reforming (DIR) reaction, water gas shift reaction (WGSR), and electrochemical reactions in SOFCs.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The electrochemical oxidation of CO in oxygen ion-conducting SOFC (O-SOFC) is considered.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The present study reveals that the performance of H-SOFC is lower than that of O-SOFC at a high temperature or at a low operating potential, as electrochemical oxidation of CO in O-SOFC contributes to power generation.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: This finding is contrary to our common understanding that proton conducting SOFC (H-SOFC) always performs better than O-SOFC.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: However, at a high operating potential of 0.8 V or at a lower temperature, H-SOFC does exhibit better performance than O-SOFC due to its higher Nernst potential and higher ionic conductivity of the electrolyte.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: This indicates that the proton conductors can be good choices for SOFCs at intermediate temperature, even with hydrocarbons fuels.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels

Sentencas: The results provide better understanding on how the electrolyte type influences the performance of SOFCs running on hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: The effect of electrolyte type on performance of solid oxide fuel cells running on hydrocarbon fuels
